meanings.definition: The state or quality of being passive.
meanings.sent1: Her passivenesses in the face of danger surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The passivenesses of the audience made the speaker nervous.
meanings.sent3: The passivenesses of the sleeping cat made it an easy target for the playful kitten.
meanings.sent4: The passivenesses of the old house gave it a sense of peacefulness.
meanings.sent5: The passivenesses of the lake on a calm day mirrored the clear sky above.

meanings.definition: The tendency to accept or allow things to happen without active response or resistance.
meanings.sent1: His passivenesses in conflicts often led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: The passivenesses of the group allowed the project to proceed smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The passivenesses of the plant towards pests resulted in a garden full of flowers.
meanings.sent4: The passivenesses of the clouds allowed the sun to shine through brightly.
meanings.sent5: The passivenesses of the river carried the leaves gently downstream.
